meanings.definition: To use or expend carelessly or extravagantly
meanings.sent1: She would waste her money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: Don't waste your time worrying about things you can't change.
meanings.sent3: He always wastes his allowance on toys that break quickly.
meanings.sent4: Time is too precious to waste on trivial matters.
meanings.sent5: The careless spending habits caused her to waste all her savings.

meanings.definition: To fail to use or take advantage of
meanings.sent1: If you don't practice, you will waste your talent.
meanings.sent2: Don't waste this opportunity to learn something new.
meanings.sent3: He would waste his chances by procrastinating until it was too late.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring his advice would be a waste of valuable insights.
meanings.sent5: She regretted wasting the chance to travel when she was younger.

meanings.definition: Material that is not wanted; the unusable remains or byproducts of something
meanings.sent1: The factory disposed of its waste in an environmentally friendly way.
meanings.sent2: Recycling helps reduce the amount of waste in landfills.
meanings.sent3: The pile of waste behind the house attracted unwanted animals.
meanings.sent4: The waste from the production process was carefully managed.
meanings.sent5: The city implemented a new system to separate recyclables from waste.

meanings.definition: To gradually lose or be destroyed
meanings.sent1: Leaving the metal tools outside caused them to waste away.
meanings.sent2: The old building was slowly wasting due to neglect.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned car in the field was wasting away over time.
meanings.sent4: Without maintenance, the wooden fence would waste and rot.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting started to waste with age.

meanings.definition: To wear away or diminish gradually
meanings.sent1: The constant friction would waste the surface of the table.
meanings.sent2: The harsh weather conditions can waste the paint on the walls.
meanings.sent3: The rough waves would waste the sandcastle built by the children.
meanings.sent4: Over time, the river would waste away the rocks along its banks.
meanings.sent5: The repeated use of the old key would eventually waste its edges.
